article: Fred Ames and I haven`t much in common. I sometimes wonder why we are friends at all .Perhaps it is Fred`s skill as a craftman that I find so _ .He`s always busy making things. Everything he makes is so perfect that I sometimes feel a bit of envy. If I _ to remark that one of my books is so _ and loose that I shall have to _ it away, Fred takes it home with him and _ it a few days later beautifully bound . If I knock over a vase and it is broken into a thousand pieces, Fred puts it together again in such a way that only an expert would see the _ . My _ is that I`m one of those hopelessly impractical and incurably lazy person. Outside my work at the office, the only thing that interests me is listening to classical music. I have a big _ of records and all day long the only thing I can think about is _ I am going to get home to listen to a new piece of music. I`ve often _ to get Fred interested in music. When I`m in one of my talkative moods (which isn`t often , by the way), I spend hours pointing out the beauties of a particular piece. I look at him as he`s gazing at that little black statue of monkey I _ in the mantelpiece and _ if he`s heard anything at all. _ I look into those big, blue, expressionless eyes of his, I realize that he hasn`t been listening to a word I`ve said. "I`d love to make a _ of that some day." He remarks, indicating the statue. One Saturday afternoon I came home from work even earlier than usual. Getting home from work is one of the few things I`m good at. It`s certainly the only time I ever _ .But this day I excelled myself. I had just bought a new record of some light music and I could hardly wait to listen to it.
